error_info.message: invalid syntax at line 45 in app.py

ai_suggestions.root_cause: Missing colon after function definition. Python requires a colon ':' at the end of function declarations, class definitions, and control flow statements.

solutions.title: Add the missing colon
solutions.description: Add a colon at the end of the function definition on line 44

solutions.title: Check for cascading syntax errors
solutions.description: Verify that all preceding lines have correct syntax, as errors often cascade

solutions.title: Use automated linting
solutions.description: Run pylint or flake8 to catch syntax errors before committing code
solutions.code_example:
# Install linter
pip install pylint

# Run on your file
pylint app.py

# Or use in VS Code
# Install Python extension and enable linting
